instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the models' performances on identifying dust sources and modeling dust-production potential in the Jazmurian basin and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the models' performances in the related study was the area-under-curve (AUC) statistic. The AUC statistic measures the overall performance of a model by calculating the area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve. The ROC curve plots the true positive rate against the false positive rate for different classification thresholds.

The AUC statistic can provide a good assessment of the accuracy of the models in predicting dust-production potential in the study area. A higher AUC value indicates a better-performing model, with values closer to 1 indicating higher accuracy. In the related study, the DLNN model had an AUC value of 0.97, which suggests a high level of accuracy in predicting dust-production potential.
